intro: Calyptrogyne spicigera, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, waxy leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in saline environments and is often found in tidal zones and mangrove swamps. Calyptrogyne spicigera plays a role in coastal ecosystems by stabilizing sediments and providing habitat for marine life.
